item.title: Command help. Need help on voids [Just a small question]
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Easy. Make a boolean player.HasItemBanked.
Make a case when the player is banking

if(ItemID != some_number){
//add the void here for banking..
}else{
//add the void here for banking again, but with
HasItemBanked = true;
}

Now

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("guthix")) {
		if (playerHasItem(2412) == true || playerHasItem(2414) == true||HasItemBanked) {
			sendMessage("You can't represent more than 1 House Of The Gods!");
		} else {
			addItem(2413, 1);
		}
	}

Read full topic
item.source: Command help. Need help on voids [Just a small question]

item.title: Command help. Need help on voids [Just a small question]
item.dc:creator: @Patchumz Patchumz
item.description:
@Patchumz wrote:

M’kay, all i need to know now is… well… i dunno what the bank voids are Otherwise, Its all good

[Thanks, Javacisnotrecognized, for the main part :P]

Okay, Well to start off, lets explain what i am trying to do. I have made a command that spawns you a god cape (guthix, sara, or zammy, depending on the command) and i have to make it so that there is no way the player can spawn more than one type of cape (Can't spawn guthix and zammy, zammy and sara, guthix and sara, or in 3 packs). What i did was this...

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("guthix")) { if (playerHasItem(2412) == true || playerHasItem(2414) == true) { sendMessage("You can't represent more than 1 House Of The Gods!"); } else { addItem(2413, 1); } }

But that only works with their current inventory, if they have a zammy or sara cape in their inventory, they can’t spawn the guthix cape, if they have zammy or sara in their bank, they can still spawn guthix. What it looks like i will have to do is add to the class files a new thing similar to playerHasItem, but built for the bank and the equip spot. I dunno for sure, but i think there isn’t one of these already, if there is, i’d like to know… obviously lol, but if there isn’t, i’d like some help please.

And thats that, i’ll just wait for some discussion. [br][size=1]Posted at: November 08, 2006, 10:03:08 PM[/size][hr]Does no one really know how to do this :$?[br][size=1]Posted at: November 09, 2006, 11:00:32 AM[/size][hr][me=Patchumz]coughs[/me]

Read full topic
